description.narrative: Stöd till kvinnors och ungdomars politiska representation och inflytande i Burkina Faso, genom bl a utbildningar riktade mot partiledningar, ungdoms- och kvinnoförbund inom sex partier i parlamentet, uppmuntran av könskvotering vid politiska val, genderkänslig budgetering i parlamentet, samt en stärkt koalition för genomförande och uppföljning av Convention on the elimination of all forms of discrimination against women (CEDAW).

Support to women's and young people's political representation and influence in Burkina Faso, through for example training of party leadership, women and youth wings in six parliamentary parties, promoting gender quota during political elections, gender-sensitive budgeting in parliament and a strengthened coalition for implementation and monitoring of the CEDAW.

participating-org.narrative: NDI/National Democratic Institute for International Affairs
NDI/National Democratic Institute for International Affairs

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: At the end of the intervention, the following fmost important results that have been achieved : 1. A combined total of 1,428 individuals (690 women, 615 young men, and 123 young women) took part in the program. The program helped six political parties to become better organized and prepared to step into leadership positions within their party. 2. Six participating parties are able to make internal procedures to facilitate the increased involvement of its women and youth. Four of six parties completed their action plans and road maps and began implementing their actions. 3. Five of the six parties completed their public policy documents on youth unemployment and young girls’ access to education and scholastic completion rate and submitted their document to party leadership for consideration and adoption into the official party platform. 4. As a result of women and youth wings capacity-building activities in communication strategies and advocacy, women and youth wings strengthened their skills in engaging party leaders and revamped their strategies to show their strengths as competitive party members. NDI’s subgrant partner, the Association of Women Lawyers of Burkina (Association des Femmes Juristes du Burkina - AFJB), conducted activities that resulted in a draft-amended quota law being completed in collaboration between participating parties and CSOs and submitted to Burkinabé authorities. 5. Multi-party trainings and conferences organized at the regional and municipal levels enabled women and youth wings for the six parties to collaborate with their local counterparts to identify and discuss the main obstacles to women and youth political participation, and propose common solutions. 6. The program contributed to reinforcing women and youth wings collaboration with civil society through regular meetings and a series of public fora held in the regional capitals of the country to discuss social perceptions of women and youth engagement in political spheres. 7. Through this program, four CSOs improved their institutional capacities to develop and engage in democratic governance initiatives including advocating for women and youth priority issues.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
